title: The Sudden-Death Phase of the Democratic Primary
description:
The Democratic presidential race has entered a phase that is specifically designed to reward front-runners and push out lesser-known candidates. We look at how that will influence the campaign. Guest: Alexander Burns, who covers national politics for The New York Times. For more information on today’s episode, visit nytimes.com/thedaily.

Background coverage:

  • Which candidates are leading the Democratic primary? Here’s a look at the state of the race.
  • Listen to an episode of “The Daily” about the intended and unintended consequences of the Democratic National Committee’s new debate qualifying rules.
author: thedaily@nytimes.com (The New York Times)
